Package org.epics.util.time

Contains basic common classes to handle time at nanosecond precision.

See: Description

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    TimeDuration
    A duration of time (such as 3 seconds, 30 ms, 1 nanosec) at the nanosecond precision.
    TimeInterval
    A period of time that spans two instances (included) at the nanosecond precision.
    TimeParser
    A helper class to parse user defined time strings to absolute or relative time durations.
    TimeRelativeInterval
    A period of time where each end can either be an absolute moment in time (e.g.
    Timestamp
    Represents a time stamp at nanosecond accuracy.
    TimestampFormat
    Implements a formatting class to format Timestamps.

Package org.epics.util.time Description

Contains basic common classes to handle time at nanosecond precision.

JSR 310 compatibility

Java 8 will introduce a better time definition that is going to be very similar to these class. That effort is unfortunately too unstable to use directly. When it will be released, the plan is to phase out this package and use the standard where possible. Same definitions and conventions are taken from JSR 310 to make future conversion easier.
